answers.answer: i dont really know the chances of premie births related to diabetes, but im sure you can find a bunch of stuff if you google it,my aunt has 7 kids and got gestational diabetes with her thrid that led to permanent diabetes (because it was untreated) and i know they watched her starting somewhere around 32 weeks to make sure the baby didnt get too big, (they didnt do a very good job tho, her last one was born 4 weeks early at 10 lbs 9.5 oz)but other then that shes had all her babies at term (even twins born at 39 weeks)good luck i hope someone can help you more then i can

Are you talking care of yourself and following medical advice?  If you are, you should have a good chance of carrying this baby to near or term.I have had several friends with gd and they all carried to term.But the person who really would have good advice is peekawho....she must be working.

I had GD for my first pg.  I went a week over, I was induced. Had a healthy baby at 8lb 8.5 oz.  So a little big but healthy.  I think as long as you control you sugar levels everything should goas planned.

i just failed the gd test. my doctor is a high risk maternal fetal medicine doctor so i think he has a good deal of experience with this. he says my risks are1. abnormally big babies that could require c-section(i am having twins)2. gd increases you risk for preeclampsia which often leads to early delivery( i have that already) preeclampsia causes the placenta to not function fully so your baby is not nourished as best it can be aside from other things.3. if you don't control your sugar your baby can be born with a dangerously low blood sugar level.4. it could become lifelong for you if uncontrolledi'm sure there is more. i was shell shocked and forgot to ask very much info.

Okay thanks!! My doc did not give me all the info on that... well how will I know if I have preeclampsia??? Do they usually test for that at every dr visit??? My cousin had it very bad and they did not catch hers until she was put in the hospital for high blood pressure at 34 weeks.....

question: i am 31 weeks and have gestational diabetes, my baby weighed 3 lbs 3 weeks ago at my sonogram and I am seeing my doc every week until delivery, what are my chances of my baby being born early do to gest diabetes?
title: chances of preterm baby
